summary: An informative video tutorial exploring different types of climbing holds and techniques to grip them.

events_list.video_caption: In the video, a man wearing a blue t-shirt, black pants, and a yellow cap is seated on a green mat in an indoor rock climbing gym. He holds a red helmet with the name "Jake" written on it in white text. The man appears to be explaining something, gesturing with his hands while holding the helmet. The gym features climbing walls with various colored holds and a water bottle placed on the floor beside him. The man then throws the helmet to the side, revealing several other helmets of different colors and designs on the floor. The atmosphere is casual and instructional, with the man engaging with the audience as he demonstrates or discusses the helmets.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a conversational introduction from a male speaker discussing "holds," "hold types," "hold terminology," and techniques for holding "these holds." He sounds casual and informative. Then, the sound of laughter briefly interjects. The speaker then announces the first category: "jugs."

events_list.video_caption: In the video, a man wearing a blue t-shirt, black pants, and a yellow cap is seated on a green mat in an indoor rock climbing gym. He is surrounded by various climbing holds, including a white one with green dots, an orange one, and a pink one with a green center. The man is explaining the different types of climbing holds, starting with the white one, which he picks up and shows to the camera. He then proceeds to pick up the orange hold, demonstrating its features and how it is used in climbing. The man continues to explain the pink hold, showing its unique shape and design. Throughout the video, the man uses hand gestures to emphasize his points and engage with the audience. The background features climbing walls with various holds and a large white climbing structure. The text "Jugs" appears on the screen, indicating the type of climbing hold being discussed. The video provides a detailed and informative look at the different climbing holds used in rock climbing, with the man's explanations and demonstrations serving as a guide for viewers.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with one person speaking, male, describing different types of climbing jugs, which are described as self-explanatory and easy to hold onto. He mentions a handlebar type jug, before describing a curved one, saying it would be good on an overhang or a roof, then a straight one, not quite as welcoming. He concludes that jugs are easy. He then pivots to mentioning that the size of a jug may affect how someone positions their hands.

events_list.video_caption: In the video, a man wearing a blue t-shirt, black pants, and a yellow cap is seated on a green mat in an indoor rock climbing gym. He is surrounded by various climbing holds, including a white one with green dots, a pink one with a green center, and an orange one with black spots. The man is holding a white climbing hold with green dots and appears to be explaining or demonstrating something about it, using hand gestures to emphasize his points. He then picks up the pink climbing hold and continues to talk, possibly comparing or contrasting the features of the two holds. The background shows climbing walls with colorful holds and a large white climbing structure. The man's facial expressions and body language suggest he is engaged in a detailed discussion or instructional session about climbing holds.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a male speaker describing the optimal hand placement on a handlebar depending on its shape, explaining how "your line of knuckles will line up with the top of the jug" for a larger handlebar and suggesting finger placement for a handlebar with "less of a curl back." The speaker's tone is instructional and relaxed. Subsequently, there's the sound of a door being opened or closed, adding a sense of a physical setting to the instruction.

events_list.video_caption: In the video, a man wearing a blue t-shirt, black pants, and a yellow cap is seen sitting on a green mat in an indoor rock climbing gym. He is surrounded by various climbing holds, including a blue and a red one, which he examines and manipulates with his hands. The man appears to be explaining or demonstrating something related to the climbing holds, as he gestures with his hands and occasionally looks at the camera. In the background, other climbers can be seen practicing on the climbing walls, which are equipped with colorful holds and features. The gym has a modern and well-lit atmosphere, with a focus on safety and functionality. The man's actions and expressions suggest that he is engaged in a detailed discussion or instructional session about climbing techniques or equipment.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip starts with a male speaker introducing the topic of slopers in climbing, addressing an audience that beginners "tend to fall down" when they encounter them. He notes the inherent difficulty compared to jugs and explains the need for proper hand positioning, emphasizing hanging low. He compares two holds, indicating one is harder due to its lack of curl, while the other is easier. He also mentions how slopers are common on "a ret" and can be tricky if there's only one. The audio clip contains ambient background sounds, including breathing, suggesting a physical activity setting.

events_list.video_caption: In the video, a man wearing a blue t-shirt, black shorts, and a yellow cap is seated on the floor of an indoor rock climbing gym. He is surrounded by various climbing holds, including green and pink ones, and is engaged in a detailed discussion about them. The man gestures with his hands, pointing to and touching the holds, indicating their features and possibly explaining their use or significance in climbing. The gym's background is filled with climbing walls and equipment, creating an atmosphere of a dedicated climbing space. The man's facial expressions and body language suggest he is knowledgeable and passionate about climbing, as he appears to be sharing his expertise with the audience. The video captures the essence of a climber's environment and the importance of understanding climbing holds in the sport.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip starts with a male speaker introducing the topic of pinches in climbing. He describes the different types of climbing holds, specifying that the one on his right is narrow and positive, making it easy to grip. Shifting to the middle hold, he notes that it is less positive and wider, requiring more strength, usually found around V3-V4 level. Turning to the hold on his left, he highlights that it is part of their hardest circuit, low profile, wide, and hard to hold at any angle other than maybe a slab. The speech is delivered in a calm and informative tone, against a background of general ambient sounds.

events_list.video_caption: In the video, a man wearing a blue t-shirt, black shorts, and a yellow cap is seated on the floor of an indoor rock climbing gym. He is surrounded by various climbing holds in different colors and shapes, including red, blue, green, and pink. The man is seen handling and examining the climbing holds, picking them up, and placing them back down. He appears to be explaining or demonstrating something about the holds, as he gestures with his hands and points to specific features. The background shows other climbers on the walls, engaged in their activities. The gym has a green floor and climbing walls with numerous holds, creating an active and vibrant atmosphere. The man's facial expressions and body language suggest he is focused and engaged in his task, possibly providing instructions or sharing insights about the climbing holds.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio begins with a male speaker describing the difference between "pinches" and other categories, explaining that a pinch will force engagement of the thumb and that thumb engagement is key. He illustrates by stating "same thing" and explains how engaging all four fingers on one side can become harder as the pinch widens. The speech transitions to describing "crimps" as the fourth category. All speech is in a conversational, explanatory tone. Background sounds consist of consistent, medium-volume ambient noise.

events_list.video_caption: In the video, a man wearing a blue t-shirt, black shorts, and a yellow cap is seated cross-legged on a green mat in an indoor rock climbing gym. He is surrounded by various climbing holds and equipment, including a red and blue helmet, a water bottle, and several colorful holds scattered around him. The man is engaged in a detailed discussion about climbing techniques, specifically focusing on "Crimps," as indicated by the text overlay in the initial frame. He uses hand gestures to emphasize his points and picks up different climbing holds to demonstrate their use and features. The background shows other climbers actively engaged in climbing on the walls, adding to the dynamic atmosphere of the gym. The man's facial expressions and body language convey his enthusiasm and expertise in the subject matter. The video maintains a consistent setting throughout, with the man continuing his explanation and demonstration, providing a comprehensive guide to climbing crimps.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a speaker asking "What's a crimp?". The speaker, a male, explains that he didn't know what a crimp was when he started climbing and clarifies the differences between a pinch and a crimp, explaining that a crimp involves using the tips of your fingers and explains what makes it a crimp rather than a "jug." He describes an orange and black hold, mentioning its positivity and ability to hold at least a pad and a half, lending itself to harder climbing. The speaker then transitions to describing a green and pink hold, noting its curl back, sharpness, and narrowness, allowing for only one pad.

events_list.video_caption: In the video, a man wearing a blue t-shirt, black shorts, and a yellow cap is seated on a green carpeted floor in an indoor rock climbing gym. He is surrounded by climbing gear, including shoes, chalk bags, and a water bottle. The man is focused on a small green object, which he examines closely, turning it around in his hands. He appears to be explaining or demonstrating something about the object, as he gestures with his hands and occasionally looks up, possibly addressing an audience. The background features climbing walls with various holds and other climbers engaged in their activities. The atmosphere is casual and instructional, with the man's actions suggesting he is sharing knowledge or tips related to climbing.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a male speaker discussing climbing techniques, specifically mentioning the importance of finger strength for "crimps". He elaborates on the development of crimping skills over time, mentioning "credit card crimps" and describing a particular hold as "completely flat" and difficult to grip. The speaker then mentions fingernails being used on holds, but concludes it doesn't work before suggesting "full crimping." Throughout the speech, the speaker maintains a calm and informative tone. A single male is speaking and sounds like he is instructing on a climbing technique.

events_list.video_caption: In the video, a man wearing a blue t-shirt, black shorts, and a yellow cap is seated cross-legged on a green mat in an indoor rock climbing gym. He is surrounded by climbing gear, including shoes, chalk bags, and climbing holds. The man is seen holding a small object, possibly a climbing tool, and appears to be explaining or demonstrating something related to climbing. The gym is bustling with activity, as other climbers can be seen in the background, some climbing on the walls and others preparing for their climb. The walls are adorned with various climbing holds of different shapes and colors, creating a vibrant and dynamic environment. The man's facial expressions and hand gestures suggest he is engaged in a detailed discussion or instruction, possibly sharing tips or techniques with the viewers. The video captures the essence of a lively climbing gym, with the man as the focal point, providing insights into the world of rock climbing.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio features a single male speaker describing different types of "crimp position" in what appears to be a climbing context. He mentions "half crimp" and "full crimp," explaining their techniques and potential dangers. The speaker then mentions a type of handle, and clarifies how the different types of crimps can put stress on tendons. Throughout, background ambient sounds suggest an indoor environment.

events_list.video_caption: In the video, a man wearing a blue t-shirt, black shorts, and a yellow cap is seated on a green mat in an indoor rock climbing gym. He is surrounded by various climbing holds and shoes, with a climbing wall in the background. The man is focused on examining and adjusting a small object, possibly a climbing accessory, while other climbers can be seen in the background. The gym is well-lit, and the atmosphere is casual and active, with climbers preparing for their climbs. The man's actions suggest he is either preparing for his climb or discussing climbing techniques.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio begins with a male speaker describing a handhold on a climbing wall, noting it's not large enough to use all four fingers, calling it a "pebble" or a "crimp" and predicting it will be difficult. He moves on to the next category which is "slots and pockets."

events_list.video_caption: In the video, a man wearing a blue t-shirt, black shorts, and a yellow cap is seated on a green mat in an indoor rock climbing gym. He is surrounded by various climbing holds in different colors and shapes, which he picks up and examines, gesturing as if explaining their features or uses. The gym's background includes climbing walls with holds and a large white climbing structure. The man appears to be engaged in a discussion or demonstration, using hand movements to emphasize his points. The setting is well-lit, and the atmosphere is casual and focused on climbing equipment.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip starts with a single male speaker describing pockets and slots in climbing, noting their different shapes and sizes. He explains that pockets often limit the number of fingers you can use, while slots restrict accuracy. Throughout his speech, the tone is informative and conversational. In the background, there's some ambient noise, possibly indicating an indoor environment with movement.

events_list.video_caption: In the video, a man wearing a blue t-shirt, black shorts, and a yellow cap is seated on the floor of an indoor rock climbing gym. He is surrounded by various colorful climbing holds, including pink, green, and white ones, scattered around him. The man appears to be engaged in a conversation or explanation, as he gestures with his hands and occasionally points to the climbing holds. He picks up a white climbing hold and shows it to the camera, followed by a green and pink one, which he examines closely. The gym's background features climbing walls with holds of different shapes and colors, and the floor is covered with a green mat. The atmosphere is casual and focused on climbing equipment. The man's facial expressions and body language suggest he is explaining or demonstrating something related to the climbing holds.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip features one male speaker explaining that holds can have a crossover between types, using examples to illustrate his points. He discusses a slot that can be a crimp, a pinch that becomes a sloper for smaller hands, and a sloper that acts more like a crimp. Further, he mentions a hold used as a pinch, but in horizontal placement, it serves more like a jug. The speaker adopts a casual and informative tone as he explains this concept. A faint background hum can be heard consistently throughout the audio clip.

events_list.video_caption: In the video, a man wearing a blue t-shirt, black shorts, and a yellow cap is seen sitting on the floor of an indoor rock climbing gym. He is surrounded by various colorful climbing holds and equipment. The man is holding a large white climbing hold with a textured surface, which he examines and manipulates with his hands. He appears to be explaining or demonstrating something about the hold, as he gestures with his hands and occasionally looks at the camera. The background features climbing walls with different colored holds and a green floor mat. The atmosphere is casual and focused on climbing activities. The man's facial expressions and body language suggest he is engaged in a conversation or presentation related to climbing equipment.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with a male speaker describing rock climbing holds, pointing out their features ("really large volume style holds") and suggesting how they might be used. He speaks in an informative, almost tutorial-like tone, and mentions the holds could be called a "wing." A second voice, also male, quips, "Like a chicken wing?" A third, possibly female, voice then adds, "Or an angel wing." The first speaker then concludes with "Jake, that was a good video," hoping it was informative.

events_list.video_caption: In the video, a man wearing a blue t-shirt and a yellow cap is seen in an indoor rock climbing gym, surrounded by climbing walls and various climbing holds. He is holding a large, white, textured object that resembles a climbing hold, and he appears to be explaining or demonstrating something about it. The man gestures with his hands, pointing to different parts of the object, and occasionally touches it to emphasize his points. In the background, other climbers can be seen practicing on the walls. The man then places a blue climbing hold on top of the white object, demonstrating how they fit together. The video concludes with the man saying "Thanks for watching," indicating the end of his presentation or demonstration. The overall atmosphere is educational and focused on climbing equipment.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a male speaker stating that he's never got wise words, before saying that climbing is subjective and that all opinions in the climbing world are subjective. He advises taking his advice with a pinch of salt and expresses the hope to build your climbing IQ, so that you know how to hold a slot or a sloper. He then asks, "What do you do?" He is speaking in a casual, conversational tone. A second male speaker can be heard briefly. The first speaker continues, saying that people will be cool if they know what a crimp is. He encourages the listener to subscribe, like, and leave a comment. Another word is uttered as he finishes this statement. The clip ends with another male speaker stating "Oh no, it's shit." Ambient background noises suggest an indoor environment.
